title: Little Harquahala Mountains
text:
The Little Harquahala Mountains are a small, arid, low-elevation mountain range of western-central <a href="Arizona">Arizona</a>, in the southeast of <a href="La%20Paz%20County%2C%20Arizona">La Paz County</a>.
The range is northwest-by-southeast-trending and is in a region of about thirty landforms, plains, valleys, and mountain ranges called the <a href="Maria%20fold%20and%20thrust%20belt">Maria fold and thrust belt</a>. The region is in the <a href="Basin%20and%20Range%20Province">Basin and Range</a> and three mountain ranges are in a parallel, northwest-by-southeast-trending <a href="thrust%20fault">thrust</a> belt, with two intervening valleys. The Little Harquahala Range borders the second valley and third mountain range, the <a href="McMullen%20Valley">McMullen Valley</a> and <a href="Harquahala%20Mountains">Harquahala Mountains</a>, on their southwest borders.
The range is a section of a <a href="water%20divide">water divide</a> for tributaries to two river watersheds on the <a href="Gila%20River">Gila</a> and <a href="Colorado%20River">Colorado River</a>s. An even smaller range is connected north on the water divide, the 8-mile (13 km) long <a href="Granite%20Wash%20Mountains">Granite Wash Mountains</a>.
Maria fold and thrust belt.
The three mountain ranges and two valleys bordered to the northeast:
Peaks and landforms.
The highest elevation in the mountains is Martin Peak at , in the southeast. Harquar Peak at is located to the central-north.
Granite Wash Pass is located at the northwest end of the mountains; <a href="Hope%2C%20Arizona">Hope</a> is west and <a href="Harcuvar%2C%20Arizona">Harcuvar, Arizona</a> is east. The pass contains a rail transportation line, as well as <a href="U.S.%20Route%2060%20in%20Arizona">U.S. Route 60 in Arizona</a> from <a href="Brenda%2C%20Arizona">Brenda</a> at <a href="Interstate%2010%20in%20Arizona">Interstate 10 in Arizona</a>, and the route northeast to <a href="Aguila%2C%20Arizona">Aguila</a>, then to <a href="Wickenburg%2C%20Arizona">Wickenburg</a>, on <a href="U.S.%20Route%2093%20in%20Arizona">U.S. 93</a>.
Bouse Wash and Centennial Wash.
The Little Harquahala Mountains are on the northwest-by-southeast <a href="water%20divide">water divide</a> between two <a href="arroyo%20%28creek%29">wash</a>es. The <a href="Bouse%20Wash">Bouse Wash</a> flows northwest to the <a href="Colorado%20River">Colorado River</a>; <a href="Centennial%20Wash%20%28Maricopa%20County%29">Centennial Wash (Maricopa County)</a> is east and flows southeast to meet the <a href="Gila%20River">Gila River</a> at the "great Gila Bend", adjacent to the <a href="Gila%20Bend%20Mountains">Gila Bend Mountains</a>.
